intro: Stillingia cochinchinensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese iron vine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported analgesic and anti-inflammatory properties. However, it is considered toxic and should be handled with care.
